intro: Menadenium, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking, often colorful flowers that resemble ghostly shapes, hence its common name. Menadenium species typically have succulent stems and leaves, adapted to arid environments. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of care.
